intro: Oenothera greggii var. typica, commonly known as the Gregg's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its stems are often hairy and erect. The species is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators like moths and bats.
